title: New products, markets add value for Texas timber - Texas Farm Bureau
summary: The article discusses how the Texas timber industry is evolving to enhance the value of trees through various products and opportunities.
green_innovation: FALSE: The article does not specifically focus on innovations that contribute towards environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article primarily covers the evolution of the Texas timber industry and does not focus on introducing significantly different new products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE: The article discusses various timber products and opportunities in the industry that aim to reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: TRUE: The article mentions strategic forest management practices, new timber products like mass timbers, and carbon sequestration benefits, all aimed at reducing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 113310 - Logging, 321113 - Sawmills, 321212 - Softwood Plywood and Veneer Manufacturing, 322130 - Paperboard Mills
greenwashing: FALSE: The article provides factual information about the Texas timber industry without misleading or exaggerating environmental claims.

title: The ultimate surf + turf: Innovative commercial baking process-meets-climate smart seaweed gains patent - BakeryAndSnacks.com
summary: Sea & Flour is introducing a line of baked goods using seaweed as a key ingredient for health benefits and environmental sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is a green innovation as it introduces a breakthrough line of baked goods using seaweed, promoting environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation as Sea & Flour is launching a new line of baked goods using seaweed as a key ingredient.
green_product: TRUE: This fits the definition of a green product as it involves baked goods designed and manufactured with seaweed to reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE: Sea & Flour's process of cold washing, processing, and granulating seaweed for use in bread aligns with green process definitions.
product_or_process: Sea & Flour baked goods using seaweed
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311812 - Commercial Bakeries, 424420 - Packaged Frozen Food Merchant Wholesalers, 111219 - Other Vegetable (except Potato) and Melon Farming, 311813 - Frozen Cakes, Pies, and Other Pastries Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE: This does not appear to be an example of greenwashing as the company is transparent about the use of seaweed for health and environmental benefits.

title: Healy is just one of the newer, weirder multi-level marketing schemes - OnlySky Media
summary: The article discusses the Healy device, a wearable gadget that claims to provide various health benefits through vibrations, marketed via a multi-level marketing approach.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 454390 - Other Direct Selling Establishments, 621511 - Medical Laboratories, 339112 - Surgical and Medical Instrument Manufacturing, 339113 - Surgical Appliance and Supplies Manufacturing

title: Centre releases fact sheet to promote agroforestry - Hindustan Times
summary: The article discusses the promotion of agroforestry in India to achieve environmental goals and financial benefits through practices like plantations and cultivation of specific tree species
green_innovation: TRUE. The promotion of agroforestry and specific tree cultivation align with environmental sustainability goals and contribute to India's aim of achieving net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2070.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus of the article is on environmental and agricultural practices, rather than new products or processes in a business context.
green_product: TRUE. The emphasis on sustainable cultivation, use of environmentally benign materials, and promotion of biodiversity supports the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes methods in agroforestry that aim to minimize environmental impact, conserve resources, and promote sustainability, aligning with the concept of green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 113310 - Logging, 113210 - Forest Nurseries and Gathering of Forest Products, 115310 - Support Activities for Forestry, 111998 - All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on promoting sustainable practices in agroforestry and conservation without any indication of false or exaggerated environmental claims.
